key_points: A gas shortage is affecting the Pensacola, Florida area.
The shortage has resulted in covered fuel pumps and long lines at stations that still have gas.
The Colonial Pipeline was shutdown due to a ransomware attack, contributing to the shortage.
AAA suggests that while Florida largely ships in its gas, the pipeline shutdown could drive up prices.
The Florida Department of Agriculture cites the pipeline hack and a truck driver shortage as reasons for the shortage.
A local fuel terminal in Pensacola failed to meet EPA standards, further impacting the supply.
Nikki Fried from FDACS highlighted the failure to meet EPA standards and has contacted the EPA for assistance.
The EPA is currently seeking more information regarding the situation.
Officials are urging residents not to panic buy or hoard gas to prevent worsening the shortage.
Residents like Tieisha Brown express concern over the potential impacts of the gas shortage on their personal safety.
spokespersons: Nikki Fried (Commissioner, Florida Department of Agriculture and Consumer Services)
